Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pernille D
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip to Rome with my class and of course I didn't expect a lot.... - But this was honestly, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! First of all, the staff at this "hotel" were so unfriendly and one of the men there didn't even speak english very well. The rooms were really dirty ( I don't think they were being cleaned every day ) and where was that safety box?! We also experienced that a few people got some money stolen from their room. The lady in the reception even admitted that one of the cleaning ladies had "cleaned up" in one of the suitcases. Only one of the men in the reception was nice and at least he spoke english. Second of all, the breakfast was horrible! - There was not a lot to choose from. I could go on and on about this hotel, but I think I've covered the most important things. - An overall very very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: VasiaAthens
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in the Hotel Mirage. Even though I had booked for the Caroline Suite, the room was very small, and they offered us a bigger room at the Hotel Mirage. Very clean room, new furniture, and everything new in the bathroom working great. The breakfast was nice, offering many things. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful, apart from one person who should me more polite to the guests. The location is super, we could see the Termini Station from the window of our room. Literally 1 minute walk from the hotel. And of course you can walk to many attractions. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Crap”
Reviews.Author: xxSB
Reviews.Content: We were on a studytrip. The Rooms was cold during the night and the blankets were just sheets. Wtf. The breakfeast was very boring and not very well tasting. If they ran out of something they simply didn't refill. Same with the plates. The staff were very unkind and acused us of many things. Sigh. The beds were very uncomfortable. But location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mllece
Reviews.Content: I paid just 55 euros for a double room with bathroom, so it's good value for money. The room was average but I will definitely go back even if it was quite cold in the room. There's a lift and the luggage room seems to be quite safe. The hotel is situated close to the Terravision bus stop at Termini Station. A taxi ride from Piazza Navona is 12 euros at night.

Reviews.Title: “Galaxy bnb reception is at the mirage - "refundable" key deposit”
Reviews.Author: kiwi126
Reviews.Content: I have tried to put a review for galaxy bnb in rome but as the mirage hotel is the reception for it, ill add it here. The galaxy is just round the corner and still very central to the train station. We were asked to provide a 20 euro deposit for the key which was so heavy we didnt want to lug it anywhere in any case. There were 4 of us on a two week trip of europe in the one room, the room was very clean, modern and quiet, excellent value in dec 2010. Breakfast was fresh and the perfect amount to set us up for the 3 days we were there. On the last day we had to catch an early train and we had breakfast at the mirage as too early for galaxy times which was fine with us. The deposit was never mentioned on checkout and as we were in a rush to get to our train we forgot to ask for it. When i emailed to ask if it could be posted i had no response so emailed again, to which they offered us 20 euro credit next time but no other alternative. Two of our group were from new zealand and unlikely to return so this wasnt great. Its also 40 dollars nz which is quite a bit to never see again for a key! I do understand hotels must get slacked off with people not returning keys and cards but i felt the hotel could have posted the money back or put it on our card. Otherwise a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: jaquelinexxx
Reviews.Content: If you need a hotel to sleep and take a rest only, this is the place. Right across the street of "Termini" (where you can go just anywhere in Rome and Italy) They serve a decent breakfast. Don;t miss the family owned cantina right next to the hotel! They have a great 3 courses diner deal for 15 euro (or so) Any food in Italy is GREAT! OMG!!

Reviews.Title: “Family room ????”
Reviews.Author: biga80
Reviews.Content: We were 5 persons, we reserved a family room for three night, big surprise, there were 5 beds separated by 20 cm each, horrible mattresses. The room looks like a hostel room. Cleanliness was good, but I recommend it for two people only.

Reviews.Title: “I've been stolen from the reception while the receptionist opening the door i don't know why she opened and so .........”
Reviews.Author: Ramy1979
Reviews.Content: while i was in hotel reception for check out and re-book some other nights after a tour of 3day in paris; the receptionist opened the door of the reception i don't know why!? it always closed except this evening!!!??? a thief enter recp. and steel my laptop bag cntains 3 passport me/wife/kid , tickets to paris, return tickets to home, near cash 4000 euro my visa expire, BVLGARI golden items,wife Visa, my 7 months kid heart medicine, we watch the useless videteo which is only for safety licence with no details hotel refused to give us room until we get another passports from our embassy they send us to another hotel to avoid any bad goodwell today i know about this site. takecare yourself in this hotel i hate it

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfort hotel”
Reviews.Author: d95
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located just across the train station; rooms are big enough and no noise; rooms have refrigerator and bathtub. Aircondition work excelent. The hotel stuff were very nice and helpful. I specially thank the lady owner, who is so friendly. The breakfast was good and the room fine. Excellent value for money.. It was in a very convenient location right by Termini station and close to all the attractions in the city of Rome. Hotel was clean, and the staff were polite, helpful and efficient. It is in a superb location for anyone arriving by train or airport bus from Ciampino & Fumincino. Lokalizacja hotelu genialna, najlepsza z mozliwych dla zwiedzania Rzymu. Praktycznie na wprost dworca Termini i metra. Tuż przy przystankach autobusów z lotniska Ciampino & Fumincino. Ładny, czysty pokój, klimatyzacja, pokoje dosc dobrze odizolowane od halasu z ulicy. Codziennie sprzątanie i wymiana ręczników. Niska cena. Śniadanie w cenie. Bardzo miła i pomocna obsługa w hotelu. Godny polecenia, myślę, że jeszcze z Ich usług skorzystam :)

Reviews.Title: “The Most Unfriendly Owner”
Reviews.Author: kamaya62
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel one night with my husband - the room was OK and we were planning to stay for another 2 or 3 nights.In the morning my step son joined us and we wanted to register him as well. The owner ( she was at the reception this day) started to scream claiming that we want to let him in with the luggage without checking in. Her poor English did not allow her to understand that we were just about to register him in. She claimed that we can get out of the hotel and she is ready to give us money back - she did it by the way. While we were packing our staff she kept on saying to my stepson that she does not like her customers and that is it! I would not recommend this place to anyone - there are plenty of hotels in Rome with much better staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very good price very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelina70london
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the services of this hotel and all the personel.location super.rooms are clean and big nice bar services in the room with all kind of drink and a cheap price . internet,tv the people at the front desk are very nice. they give me all the information all kind of tours ...yes I will go again!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch even if I was a returning customer!”
Reviews.Author: PaintItaly
Reviews.Content: I returned to Hotel Mirage with two friends because my daughter and I had such a positive experience here three years ago. All my emails confirmed my request for two rooms at Hotel Mirage. When we arrive at 4 PM we were taken up the Hotel Mirage elevator, taken out a door into a connecting building and shown two rooms in Hotel Halifax. Neither room was the quality of the Hotel Mirage, the door where we exited the Hotel Mirage did not allow return access. There is no elevator to the 5th floor where our rooms were in Hotel Halifax. The staff, two disagreeable women, refused to change the rooms, were rude, lied about the condition of Hotel Halifax and refused to admit we did not have the what I reserved. They repeatedly said the rooms were the same in both hotels. We went out to look for another hotel without success. After dinner when we returned I found my single room was dirty, had a used pair of women's underwear behind the luggage stand, vintage dust bunnies under the bed and in every corner, smelled of sewer gas off and on during the three days, ONE TOWEL, no bath mat for the slippery wet tile floor and no cups for water were in the room. I was finally given a small towel the third day. The sheets were not clean and they were replaced the following day. I drank a bottle of water from the filthy refrigerator and told the desk I would not pay for it because there were no cups in the room. I got two cups. The "lobby" of Hotel Halifax has mattresses stored behind the curtains. Fire code anyone? These were the last three days in Italy after 23 great days in Sicily where there are far fewer tourist facilities but with great experiences. When you know you have a returning customer bringing more customers would it not be good business to develop more customers in the same way. The women at the desk were the two most disagreeable people, probably not Italian, I had the displeasure to deal with. They blamed co-workers when clearly they were the ones in charge. They should be ashamed to represent Italy. I wish I knew I this site accepted photos. That dirty thong lying in the dust bunnies was quite the still life.

Reviews.Title: “A TERRIBLE hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nokard
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (3 of us) found this place by just walking in and thinking it looked nice and the price seemed reasonable for a 3 star hotel. We gave a $20 (euro) deposit for the key to our room (which was given back when we left) and we had to pay the full amount up front for our stay. The hotel building is also shared by at least one other hotel. We had to use the entrance of the other hotel to use the elevator to get up to our room. There was no elevator from our hotel entrance, only stairs. The airconditioning in our room was not as cold as we would have liked it to be and we had the fan on the maximum setting. The towels smelled like vinegar and the bed sheets had many hairs in them after close inspection. I think the place had bed bugs because we were all slapping and scratching ourselves throughout the 2 night we stayed. One morning we awoke early to someone talking loudly in the hallway outside our room.That same morning my friend found some kind of "finger" nail with hair or fur on it that he had been sleeping on. Uugghh!!! Breakfast was included, but we avoided it. There were some cold cuts, toast, cereal, jam, orange juice and warm yogurt that was out for who knows how long. The drinking glasses were all different shapes and sizes and had many scratch markings on them. Outside the hotel at night didn't have a safe feeling. There were some "shady" characters out there.The only good thing about this place is that it's near the Termini train station which makes getting around Rome more easy. This is definitely NOT a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Forget this hotel... It´s terrible and so are most people who work there.”
Reviews.Author: Marlos_Sousa
Reviews.Content: I promised my mom we would be in Rome for her birthday celebration. And so we arrived the night before coming from Pisa. At first when we arrived the girl in the reception noted in my mom´s passport her upcoming birthday and congratulated her. I though that to be so kind of her. However, our following experiences at Hotel Mirage were not that good at all. Although not mentioned on its website, I was not allowed to pay with my credit card. In accordance with the lady in the reception, that policy was due to a highly discounted rate... I know they have the right to refuse credit cards if they want, but I would highly appreciate if that was stated clearly in their website. In my case, I had a credit card that permitted international withdrawals, but there might be someone who could not get cash abroad to pay for it. The second problem was regarding the breakfast. Well, not the breakfast itself, but the badly educated girl that was responsable for the breakfast room. At first she was able to speak only italian. No English at all, no French, No Spanish, just Italian. I know Italian is the official language of Italy, but being Rome a tourist city and being that Hotel dedicated to tourist (at least I imagine that because it is actually located beside Rome´s main train station), it would be a great deal if all of its employees could speak at least basic words in English, like milk, coffee, water, well, these may make you imagine that she could not speak no English at all.... and that was true. The other problem with this girl is that she was so rude... she could not spek softly, but she screamed at all time, making one think that she was making you a great favor to let you have the breakfast you had paid for.... I am sorry, but I can't cope with stupid people... To complete mu unsatisfaction with that hotel, at 10:30am someone was knocking on my door and screaming loudly in Italian... I really don´t know what she was screaming, but I can imagine that she complained cos I did not leave the room before that time. However, to my knowledge, there was no time to leave the rooms or to arrive... otherwise that hotel would not be a hotel, but a hostel... She did not start her show outside until I woke up and open the door. For my surprise and disgust, she was the same girl that I had problems in the breakfast... We had a terrible discussion in the aisle, but I imagine she did not understand anything I said at all. To finalize, the day before we checked out I was asked to pay for our stay (I stayed 4 nights there). However, the lady in the reception said that I was not given back my 20 euro deposit until we check out next morning, because she was affraid we would take home her remote control and room key... Well, as you can imagine, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in a good place to enjoy all of Rome's attractions. By staying there you´ll certainly get into disgusting troubles that may compromise you Rome visit. Not to forget, although the rooms are small, they´re quite confortable, but it´s worth mentioning that they turn on heating around 10 pm and turn it off at 7:00. Therefore the remaing of the day your room gets very cold if you travel in winter like I did. Also, although there´s an air conditions device in the room we cannot use it because it´s opperated with a remote control that does not exist. To summarize, forget this hotel. If you want to be next to Termini Station in Rome there are plenty of hotels nearby.... everywhere you look in this street and also on Via Marsala beside the station there are hotels and restaurants... so it wont be any trouble to find another better place to stay with competitive prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice economy hotel”
Reviews.Author: chomskey_on_the_rox
Reviews.Content: Nice for a few days' stay, clean, we had typical Italian breakfast [coffee + croissant/roll], friendly staff, good location if you want to do some sightseeing [centre], although the near Termini station attracts plenty of weird guys. Generally, quite good conditions [although not de luxe] for reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The clerk immediately asked for cash when we checked in. We requested for a wake-up call and never received it hence, we missed our trip to Pompeii. Had to take a cab to the airport which we had to pay for in cash. Will definitely NOT recommend to anybody who wants to enjoy their stay in Rome! Scary place!!!
